title: BEST COMMUNITY EVER! I LOVE PLAYING WITH THESE GUYS!!!!!!!!!
body: I love when I get on to play League, a game known for its AMAZING community, and I encounter players like our Hecarim. Man, I just love playing a game, a Normal Game, mind you, and people take it so seriously as to wish death on other players! Nothing says "I need to re-queue and play another game because that was a blast" like death threats. It's a real shame that I can only honor him once per game :( He should have all the badges tbh because it was his constant name calling and threats that had me motivated to take it to the next level.  Oh, I forgot to mention he kept threatening to afk/quit. #bestgameofalltime

Stop.

You are derailing a conversation regarding the toxicity of the player displayed by the OP. Regardless of your view on the existential question of "what is evil?", the evidence shows the Hecarim player making three death threats and using a racial slur twice, among a litany of cursing/profanity/aggression. I believe this is an unacceptable use of the chat function. The player is not helping his team in any way by communicating these messages to them. In fact, he is actively creating a hostile environment for his team. I would be surprised to find someone who would find this behavior acceptable or tolerable. Do you agree with his method of communicating? Is this something that you would have us tolerate? What is the good in this behavior? What is he accomplishing for his team by sending these messages? Even if you remove the violence in his words, he is using chat to spam information of no relevance to his team winning or losing. I fail to see any perspective in which this specific circumstance is anything but violence, profanity, and misconduct. Perhaps we should review the Summoner's Code: http://gameinfo.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/game-info/get-started/summoners-code/
I didn't see him defending what happened in the OP's pictures. Not once. Please keep that in mind.

Maybe I've had it long enough to know how to avoid certain situations when I need to, but it just seems silly for the advice "If you are depressed, don't go into a place where people will harass you for ANYTHING" to be looked down on. Do you also dislike telling people with shellfish allergies not to eat shellfish?

I'm not advocating the threats to random strangers through a video game (or through anything, really), but if you are in a position where you are considering suicide (or hell, anything close to that), it never helps to go to a place where the attitudes of players range from "What's up everyone, dance party mid" to "I WILL KILL EVERYTHING THAT YOU LOVE, YOU WORTHLESS SLIMEBALL" and just kinda roll the dice without any precautions.

So please, educate me on why I think this view point is wrong, I'd love to here about it.

You are wrong because you can do whatever you think it is best for you. You can play and mute everyone or you can hide in a cave and avoid human interaction forever if that's what you think it is best for you. And that is ok. But that doesn't mean that everyone else has to or should. People with depression and mental/steem issues should be able to enjoy the things they enjoy and to live life normally. You can't just tell them to not get out of their houses because they might meet people who are mean. Instead, we have to do our best to eradicate that behavior so everybody can live much safer and happier.
We don't end bullying at school by not sending our children to school. We end it by educating and by spreading awareness.

If there was a dangerous ally where there was a high likelihood of getting mugged, someone who was particularity vulnerable or gave off a victim vibe would be an idiot to use said ally.   This does not mean that we should not attempt to improve safety in said region, but in the mean time, and possibly indefinitely it would only be ethically to warn people, in particularly vulnerable people to avoid said area.  

There is far more to life than League so if some people are unable to experience it due to mental health risks it is unfortunate but it is not the end of the world or even a particularly great misfortune.  We should certainly attempt to improve League as much as possible but in the meantime we can take precautions.  As for the schooling example, with the current state of the US school system, if parents have the time and resources to do so it is far better to just switch to homeschooling or some other option.  They should still support positive change, but there is absolutely no reason they should compromise their own children while cleaning up a serious mess.

No. You can see this same behavior pretty much everywhere on the internet. Are you suggesting that people with depression should stay away from the internet and isolated from the rest of the world so they don't risk their health by not interacting with anyone? Certainly that's not the answer. 
Stop saying the victims to go somewhere else, to play something different, to not dress so "provocatively", to not live life. It is not the victim's fault. Lets address this issue and start taking step to eradicate these online harassers from places like this one.

It is possible you are reading more into my reply then is actually there or it is possible you just have a unrealistic view of the world in general.  I am certainly for taking measures to improve safety for all users under all circumstances (providing there is some regard for individual freedom) but unless people enjoy being victimized they should either avoid the risky circumstances or better prepare themselves for such encounters.  They also owe it to others to raise awareness of the situation and everyone else should work to improve the situation, but if something poses a significant threat, the first logical step is to isolate one from the threat.

As for the assertions that similar behavior is found everywhere on the internet, there is certainly some truth to that, but League and other massively popular games tend to be cesspools of sociopathic behavior, far worse then most other games or sites.  If someone actually has a mental condition which would make it risky for them to play league there is an incredible array of other option for them to use until said problems are dealt with, if that ever happens.  

Sorry for not responding sooner, but I've been quite busy lately, I would love to discuss this further as this disagreement seems to be largely related to personal responsibility and agency vs what might be termed social responsibility, but unfortunately I will be away from the internet for the next few months.  Feel free to respond for the benefit of any other readers, but by the time I get back this thread is going to be long since buried.

I just had a Nasus top, who I ganked for early cause he was against a Vlad, who then afterwards would continually try to fight vlad and then just get out sustained cause he started Doran's Shield then rushed a Tri Force.  Didn't even bother with stacking his Q.

So even though I had just ganked for him and both mid and bot needed help (cause every lane always needs loads of help in this ridiculous silver ELO), he then spam pinged on top of me and said I HAD to gank for him again.  I calmly explained to him that all he had to do was farm and build MR and that I had to gank the other lanes.  Bot lane was after all already flaming me as well, cause welcome to silver

"Just getting your second buff and recalling after a successful gank top side?  YOU SHOULD HAVE GANKED BOT TWICE ALREADY! HERPY DERPA DERP!"

Anyway, instead of doing the normal thing and playing safe, warding, and waiting for me to make the rounds of winning every single lane for my team on my own, he then says the typical "if you don't gank in 2 mins I'm afk feeding at 20."  My Zed was luckily the only other mature one on the team and tried to back me up, but by doing so Nasus flamed him for a bit as well until Zed gave up and muted the kid.  So, I go to gank bot and we get one kill and then a dragon, Zed even managed to force the enemy Talon off the tower so we head mid to force it down quickly.  Meanwhile top Nasus over extends chasing Vlad past the minion waves for no reason and Olaf shoes up, then instead of flashing out and running from the lvl 5 Olaf he tries to 1v2 them since he was lvl 6.  He dies and preceeds to rage up a storm like I have not seen in a very long time, all directed at me personally and how I'm an awful jungler and he was for sure just going to troll and feed now, all cause I wasn't there for the counter gank... and got a kill, dragon, and tower with my team instead....

He then continued to do this for a few more minutes, just none stop harassing, it was so bad bot lane even shut up and stopped harassing me, cause I was doing perfectly fine and they didn't have much reason too anymore and Nasus was dong so anyway.  I then muted him, told him I would, and I guess after finally realizing I wasn't just saying it he started to feed on purpose cause "my jungler was completely useless!"  As he put in the end game chat.

So I feel your pain, and only the enemy Vlad stuck around to report him with me, even my own team all left instantaneously, so I doubt that childish Nasus will get enough reports to warrant a look, at least not that match, so for now he's prob going to get away with it.

People are just generally pathetic, and for some reason this game brings out the most pathetic side a person can muster.  No idea why, but it's all too common and not nearly punished enough.
